No need to know the nAme. 
Swoon and marvel at simple things.
LOST defined life. Live in the Enchanted Forest. Love what happens in Westeros. Wish you could hang out in Rosewood with some pretty little liars. Agonize over the events in Beacon Hills. And so on. Unconditional Cut & Run, Titanic and LOTR lover. 
Proud Princess Aurora, Sansa Stark and Alison Dilaurentis supporter.

summary: Sansa doesn't have a theme like the other characters you named because she was never that important as a character, D&D gave her...
question: Sansa doesn't have a theme like the other characters you named because she was never that important as a character, D&D gave her more importance in the show that what she has in the books
answer: Perhaps. We’ll see about that. Still the soundtrack follows the show right ? It can’t follow the book after all. So I’d be interested in an analysis from Djawadi on why he created specific character themes for some and not for others. And that applies not only to Sansa, who, by your own admission, does have some importance in the show at least but also to Bran, Tyrion or Jaime for example who have all managed to make it to the end and like Sansa, still don’t have themes of their own aside from the Stark and Lannister themes. And in terms of importance, these three do hold importance both in the books and in the show - and yet …

And in terms of importance, these three do hold importance both in the books and in the show - and yet …

summary: You know what i want ? A proper musical theme for Sansa in Season 8. She's one of the few characters who still doesn't have a...
body: You know what i want ? A proper musical theme for Sansa in Season 8. She’s one of the few characters who still doesn’t have a proper character theme when Jon, Arya, Dany, Cersei all have at least one. Analyzing her musical cues you notice that it reflects her journeys on the show - a Baratheon variation in Season 1, variations of Chaos is a Ladder when she’s with Littlefinger and of course, her main theme, the Stark theme later in Seasons 6 and 7. But I want a new, original composition from Ramin Djawadi. I think that now that she’s done following and blending around, now that she has found her true identity, she can exist by herself and have her own theme. Too much to ask ?

But I want a new, original composition from Ramin Djawadi. I think that now that she’s done following and blending around, now that she has found her true identity, she can exist by herself and have her own theme. Too much to ask ?

She’s one of the few characters who still doesn’t have a proper character theme when Jon, Arya, Dany, Cersei all have at least one. Analyzing her musical cues you notice that it reflects her journeys on the show - a Baratheon variation in Season 1, variations of Chaos is a Ladder when she’s with Littlefinger and of course, her main theme, the Stark theme later in Seasons 6 and 7. But I want a new, original composition from Ramin Djawadi. I think that now that she’s done following and blending around, now that she has found her true identity, she can exist by herself and have her own theme. Too much to ask ?

She’s one of the few characters who still doesn’t have a proper character theme when Jon, Arya, Dany, Cersei all have at least one. Analyzing her musical cues you notice that it reflects her journeys on the show - a Baratheon variation in Season 1, variations of Chaos is a Ladder when she’s with Littlefinger and of course, her main theme, the Stark theme later in Seasons 6 and 7. But I want a new, original composition from Ramin Djawadi. I think that now that she’s done following and blending around, now that she has found her true identity, she can exist by herself and have her own theme. Too much to ask ?

summary: Is there a chance that someone from Stark kids will die next season? I'm quite sure Sansa is surviving, but don't know about...
question: Is there a chance that someone from Stark kids will die next season? I'm quite sure Sansa is surviving, but don't know about Bran and Arya. Especially Arya.
answer: I think when they killed Rickon, they were done killing Starks. Sansa, Bran and Arya are safe. The last season will see them using their skills for a common goal.

reblog.comment: I think when they killed Rickon, they were done killing Starks. Sansa, Bran and Arya are safe. The last season will see them using their skills for a common goal.

trail.content_raw: I think when they killed Rickon, they were done killing Starks. Sansa, Bran and Arya are safe. The last season will see them using their skills for a common goal.
trail.content: I think when they killed Rickon, they were done killing Starks. Sansa, Bran and Arya are safe. The last season will see them using their skills for a common goal.

summary: to all game of thrones fandom: we can all disagree on things, stan that character or the other, ship this or that, that’s all...
body: to all game of thrones fandom: we can all disagree on things, stan that character or the other, ship this or that, that’s all fine… we even cross lines and have insane discourses and make hateful posts. but my grandparents, mainly my grandfather, is being dragged into a fandom discourse as a “gross man” because @sayruq and @cmollyo want to make a point. can you guys please learn to have boundaries? don’t fucking insult people’s families because they disagree with you, don’t fucking insult people’s families when you don’t know anything about them. it’s the second time people shit on my grandparents. THE SECOND TIME.

reblog.comment: to all game of thrones fandom: we can all disagree on things, stan that character or the other, ship this or that, that’s all fine… we even cross lines and have insane discourses and make hateful posts. but my grandparents, mainly my grandfather, is being dragged into a fandom discourse as a “gross man” because @sayruq and @cmollyo want to make a point. can you guys please learn to have boundaries? don’t fucking insult people’s families because they disagree with you, don’t fucking insult people’s families when you don’t know anything about them. it’s the second time people shit on my grandparents. THE SECOND TIME.

THE SECOND TIME.

THE SECOND TIME.

summary: I know that GRRM has mentioned that the placing/the order of his chapters is very important, and I noticed something while...
body:
I know that GRRM has mentioned that the placing/the order of his chapters is very important, and I noticed something while reading a Clash of Kings that struck me as odd.

One of Sansa’s chapters in a Clash of Kings ends with Cersei telling her this.

“I see flowering hasn’t made you any brighter. Sansa, permit me to share a bit of womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. Love is poison. A sweet poison, yes, but it will kill you all the same”

And then the next chapter is none other than Jon’s, connecting the two of them to Sansa’s flowering and the sweet poison of love.

summary: You are one of my favorite Jonsa bloggers, and I loved your answer to the other anon on Jon's resurrection. It's interesting to...
question: You are one of my favorite Jonsa bloggers, and I loved your answer to the other anon on Jon's resurrection. It's interesting to think how this will go in the books.  While I don't know whether we'll get Jon in Ghost POV, I think we will definitely see a fight between Ghost and Ramsey's dogs.  This is foreshadowed in the first book when Jon gives Ghost half a honeyed chicken, and Ghost fends off a black dog looking to take the chicken. A honeyed chicken sounds like slang for names for girls.
answer:
(2)  Here’s the full quote:  "Dogs moved between the tables, trailing after the serving girls. One of them, a black mongrel bitch with long yellow eyes, caught a scent of the chicken. She stopped and edged under the bench to get a share. Jon watched the confrontation. The bitch growled low in her throat and moved closer. Ghost looked up, silent, and fixed the dog with those hot red eyes. The bitch snapped an angry challenge. She was three times the size of the direwolf pup. Ghost did not move.      

(3)  He stood over his prize and opened his mouth, baring his fangs. The bitch tensed, barked again, then thought better of this fight. She turned and slunk away, with one last defiant snap to save her pride. Ghost went back to his meal.“  In terms of how we will know Jon loves Sansa, I think Jon’s resurrection will be more traumatic in the books.

(4) We may get Jon’s POV that he has inappropriate feelings for Sansa, but the reader won’t be able to tell whether this is a side effect of the resurrection. Then, Jon will go to see Dany, and his POV will be hidden. The audience may even root for him to fall in love with Dany to stop his inappropriate feelings for Sansa. It may seem like he is getting over his “weird” Sansa feelings. Then, R+L=J will be revealed   along with the truth that Jon has always loved Sansa. Would love any thoughts?  

Dear nonny,

if I remember correctly GRRM himself also wanted a dog-wolves fight in season 4, the last season he was involved in - a possible foreshadowing of Jon’s fight with Ramsay. I must admit that I love Jon in Ghost so much that I wrote a series of ficlet about this, how it might play out. I would be so excited about Jon fighting in Ghost against Ramsay’s dogs!

I would also alert you to the fact that there is another instance of ‘Jon’ fighting over a bird:

"That’s the real king of this castle right there,” one of the gold cloaks had told her. “Older than sin and twice as mean. One time, the king was feasting the queen’s father, and that black bastard hopped up on the table and snatched a roast quail right out of Lord Tywin’s fingers. Robert laughed so hard he like to burst. You stay away from that one, child.” (AGOT, Arya III)

That black cat Arya chases in the Red Keep is a Jon stand-in. And here we have a small bird that will be snatched from a Lannister. So, Jon probably will save Sansa from Ramsay’s dogs and from the Lannisters (if there will be a kidnapping).

As for how Jonsa will play out after his ressurection I can easily picture your scenario. I guess we could get Jon being in confusion about who is Sansa and mixing her up with Ygritte and this would play into the depiction of Political Jon. As you said, the reader probably would root for Jon to fall for Dany to get rid of his feelings for Sansa. And this bias would lead to the reader not realising that something is off until the rug is pulled under him/her. I do think this is a very likely scenario and one which I would thoroughly enjoy. I really would like to have TWOW right now!

Thanks for your thoughts and your ask! I really appreciate the compliment and I’m glad you like my blog!

Ghost looked up, silent, and fixed the dog with those hot red eyes. The bitch snapped an angry challenge. She was three times the size of the direwolf pup. Ghost did not move.

As for how Jonsa will play out after his ressurection I can easily picture your scenario. I guess we could get Jon being in confusion about who is Sansa and mixing her up with Ygritte and this would play into the depiction of Political Jon. As you said, the reader probably would root for Jon to fall for Dany to get rid of his feelings for Sansa. And this bias would lead to the reader not realising that something is off until the rug is pulled under him/her. I do think this is a very likely scenario and one which I would thoroughly enjoy. I really would like to have TWOW right now!

Thanks for your thoughts and your ask! I really appreciate the compliment and I’m glad you like my blog!

trail.content_raw:
(2)  Here’s the full quote:  "Dogs moved between the tables, trailing after the serving girls. One of them, a black mongrel bitch with long yellow eyes, caught a scent of the chicken. She stopped and edged under the bench to get a share. Jon watched the confrontation. The bitch growled low in her throat and moved closer. Ghost looked up, silent, and fixed the dog with those hot red eyes. The bitch snapped an angry challenge. She was three times the size of the direwolf pup. Ghost did not move.      

(3)  He stood over his prize and opened his mouth, baring his fangs. The bitch tensed, barked again, then thought better of this fight. She turned and slunk away, with one last defiant snap to save her pride. Ghost went back to his meal.“  In terms of how we will know Jon loves Sansa, I think Jon’s resurrection will be more traumatic in the books.

(4) We may get Jon’s POV that he has inappropriate feelings for Sansa, but the reader won’t be able to tell whether this is a side effect of the resurrection. Then, Jon will go to see Dany, and his POV will be hidden. The audience may even root for him to fall in love with Dany to stop his inappropriate feelings for Sansa. It may seem like he is getting over his “weird” Sansa feelings. Then, R+L=J will be revealed   along with the truth that Jon has always loved Sansa. Would love any thoughts?  

Dear nonny,

if I remember correctly GRRM himself also wanted a dog-wolves fight in season 4, the last season he was involved in - a possible foreshadowing of Jon’s fight with Ramsay. I must admit that I love Jon in Ghost so much that I wrote a series of ficlet about this, how it might play out. I would be so excited about Jon fighting in Ghost against Ramsay’s dogs!

I would also alert you to the fact that there is another instance of ‘Jon’ fighting over a bird:

"That’s the real king of this castle right there,” one of the gold cloaks had told her. “Older than sin and twice as mean. One time, the king was feasting the queen’s father, and that black bastard hopped up on the table and snatched a roast quail right out of Lord Tywin’s fingers. Robert laughed so hard he like to burst. You stay away from that one, child.” (AGOT, Arya III)

That black cat Arya chases in the Red Keep is a Jon stand-in. And here we have a small bird that will be snatched from a Lannister. So, Jon probably will save Sansa from Ramsay’s dogs and from the Lannisters (if there will be a kidnapping).

As for how Jonsa will play out after his ressurection I can easily picture your scenario. I guess we could get Jon being in confusion about who is Sansa and mixing her up with Ygritte and this would play into the depiction of Political Jon. As you said, the reader probably would root for Jon to fall for Dany to get rid of his feelings for Sansa. And this bias would lead to the reader not realising that something is off until the rug is pulled under him/her. I do think this is a very likely scenario and one which I would thoroughly enjoy. I really would like to have TWOW right now!

Thanks for your thoughts and your ask! I really appreciate the compliment and I’m glad you like my blog!
trail.content:
(2)  Here’s the full quote:  "Dogs moved between the tables, trailing after the serving girls. One of them, a black mongrel bitch with long yellow eyes, caught a scent of the chicken. She stopped and edged under the bench to get a share. Jon watched the confrontation. The bitch growled low in her throat and moved closer. Ghost looked up, silent, and fixed the dog with those hot red eyes. The bitch snapped an angry challenge. She was three times the size of the direwolf pup. Ghost did not move.      

(3)  He stood over his prize and opened his mouth, baring his fangs. The bitch tensed, barked again, then thought better of this fight. She turned and slunk away, with one last defiant snap to save her pride. Ghost went back to his meal.“  In terms of how we will know Jon loves Sansa, I think Jon’s resurrection will be more traumatic in the books.

(4) We may get Jon’s POV that he has inappropriate feelings for Sansa, but the reader won’t be able to tell whether this is a side effect of the resurrection. Then, Jon will go to see Dany, and his POV will be hidden. The audience may even root for him to fall in love with Dany to stop his inappropriate feelings for Sansa. And this bias would lead to the reader not realising that something is off until the rug is pulled under him/her. I do think this is a very likely scenario and one which I would thoroughly enjoy. I really would like to have TWOW right now!

blog.description: Sansor/Sansa AO3 feed. Askbox on just in case. Happy shipping!

title: Boss
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2RYV5i0

by swimmingfox

Sansa’s starting a new job in Manchester just as Sandor realises something massive. Arya’s entering the terrifying world of the House of Black and White in Bristol as a graphic design intern.

ANOTHER continuation of the Potential series, which will go on until they have all died (or I have). Do read earlier ones in the series before you start this one! It’s also very ensemble, not just le SanSan.

Words: 2206, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M, M/M
  • Characters: Sansa Stark, Sandor Clegane, Arya Stark, Podrick Payne, Jojen Reed, Edd Tollett, Missandei (ASoIaF), Robb Stark, Margaery Tyrell, Jon Snow, The Waif (ASoIaF), Jaqen H'ghar, Aoife (original character)
  • Relationships: Sandor Clegane/Sansa Stark, Podrick Payne/Arya Stark, Jojen Reed/Bran Stark, Robb Stark/Margaery Tyrell
  • Additional Tags: Potential forever, no I mean really, It goes on as long as I go on, Babies, Work, Jobs, Jojen’s in NYC, Forest schools, Northern powerhouse, internships, Bristol, Manchester, UK - Freeform


read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2RYV5i0

blog.name: sanrionlannistark
blog.title: The Lady of Casterly Rock
blog.description:
For the love of Lannisters and Sansa Stark

I ship: Sanrion | Braime | Jornaerys | Gendrya

summary: Some of you have never been forced to marry a dwarf whose family is your family’s most hated enemy, then realized he’s actually...
body: Some of you have never been forced to marry a dwarf whose family is your family’s most hated enemy, then realized he’s actually the nicest guy you’ve ever met, but only after he’s escaped from prison and fled the country, and you’ve been forced into marriage to a sociopath, and it shows.

reblog.comment: Some of you have never been forced to marry a dwarf whose family is your family’s most hated enemy, then realized he’s actually the nicest guy you’ve ever met, but only after he’s escaped from prison and fled the country, and you’ve been forced into marriage to a sociopath, and it shows.

trail.content_raw: Some of you have never been forced to marry a dwarf whose family is your family’s most hated enemy, then realized he’s actually the nicest guy you’ve ever met, but only after he’s escaped from prison and fled the country, and you’ve been forced into marriage to a sociopath, and it shows.
